item.title: Globebill is establishing a payment and bank card settlement system in Saudi Arabia
item.description:
Globebill, a global online payment company, has partnered with Saudi Arabia to establish cross-border trade settlement services. This initiative aligns with China’s “One Belt and One Road” project. Through this partnership, Globebill will introduce a payment and bank card settlement system in Saudi Arabia. This system will issue credit cards to individuals and businesses, facilitating trade between China and Saudi Arabia through Globebill’s platform. Both entities will collaborate to promote Globebill’s payment and settlement services, including the issuance of personal and corporate credit cards across the Middle East and North Africa...

item.title: Beocord 9000: Exchanging the Rubber Parts in the Tape Mechanism
item.description:
My Beocord 9000 restoration project saw some good progress. I recently installed new rubber tires on the idler wheels of the tape drive mechanism to address a rewinding issue. The deck wasn’t rewinding smoothly, becoming very slow and sometimes even stopping at the end of the process. This seemed like a common problem attributed to hardened idler wheel rubber, as suggested by Beoworld.org. However, upon disassembling the mechanism, I discovered that a previous repair attempt had damaged a crucial friction pad, which was the root cause of the problem...

item.title: Beocord 5000 (4715/4716): Recapping the Preamplifier and the Radio Amplifier Boards
item.description:
Let’s review the Beocord 5000! This model contains many tantalum capacitors that, due to their age (around 35 years), should be replaced. Tantalum capacitors pose a fire risk if they short circuit because of the intense heat released when tantalum reacts with oxygen. While tantalum capacitors were favored in the 1970s due to their smaller size compared to aluminum electrolytic capacitors, advancements in manufacturing have closed the size gap. Today, modern aluminum capacitors can be just as small as the older tantalum ones...

item.title: Beocord 5000 (4715/4716): Calibrating Recording Current and Bias
item.description:
Pleased with the seemingly functional Beocord 5000 (4715/4716) tape mechanism, an initial test recording was conducted using a waveform generator. Playback revealed a 3 dB channel imbalance on the Peak Program Meter (PPM), indicating a calibration issue. This was unsurprising given the deck’s age and highlighted the fortunate performance of a previously rebuilt Beocord 5000 in a Beolab 6000 setup, which operated well without calibration. item.title: Beocord 5000 (4715/4716): Calibrating the Peak Program Meters (VU Meters)
item.description:
After reassembling and successfully testing a Beocord 5000 tape deck, I decided to calibrate its Peak Program Meters (PPMs) according to the service manual. Instead of directly inputting a 300 Hz signal into the Dolby B ICs as the manual suggested, I opted to feed a 25 mV, 300 Hz signal into the Beocord’s inputs while in record mode (paused). Using a multimeter, I adjusted the recording levels to achieve the specified 740 mV RMS output at the Dolby B ICs (pin 7), allowing for the calibration of the PPMs’ 0 dB level...

item.title: Beocord 9000: Belt Deterioration
item.description:
Replacing rubber belts is a standard restoration procedure for old audio equipment. However, Beocord 8000 and 9000 tape decks often require an extra step: cleaning up the mess left behind by deteriorated belts. Most Beocords I’ve encountered have belts degraded into a sticky, gooey substance, probably due to prolonged storage in warm conditions. Like cars, these devices suffer from lack of regular use.
